title: How do rappers make money if many people don’t even pay for music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically people do pay for music. Streaming services like Apple Music and Spotify cost per month. Then rappers get paid for however much their music was streamed. For most rappers, most of the money they make comes from touring. If you’re a big rapper like Drake, Wayne, J Cole or Kendrick Lamar you can make good money off of sponsorships and appearances. A lot of rappers also make money from the music they post on YouTube and publishing royalties.

Subscription based Streaming services (spotify, itunes etc) all pay a small royalty to the artists, streams = pays just like youtube viewsyoutube adsense payouts (millions of views on a music video makes more than a single sales on a $0.99 download or $5 album does often)Big money is actually in the touring and live shows, and licensed merchandise such as clothing / shoes or a game / app / movie deals (cameos, endorsements, product placements, industry plant shout outs etc)But bottom line is - If they are really what they say they are, they already mad rich and just showing off all their money from trapping
